ticket.title: Duplicate association conditions are generated when using a named_scope on an association
ticket.original-body:
Probably not a bug, as it does not change the behavior. But I spent the afternoon tracking down why my association conditions were being applied twice in the query, so hopefully this ticket will prevent others from wasting an afternoon.
#1960 introduced this behavior.
So when you do Foo.my_assoc.my_scope: When my_scope gets constructed it is within the scope of my_assoc, so it saves that scope's finder conditions internally. When you then evaluate the scope and the association to fetch records, my_assoc and my_scope both apply the association finder conditions separately so you end up with it twice in your query.
I'm guessing this is fixed in rails 3 by arel, but I have not checked.

So when you do Foo.my_assoc.my_scope: When my_scope gets constructed it is within the scope of my_assoc, so it saves that scope's finder conditions internally. When you then evaluate the scope and the association to fetch records, my_assoc and my_scope both apply the association finder conditions separately so you end up with it twice in your query.
I'm guessing this is fixed in rails 3 by arel, but I have not checked.

Probably not a bug, as it does not change the behavior. But I spent the afternoon tracking down why my association conditions were being applied twice in the query, so hopefully this ticket will prevent others from wasting an afternoon.

#1960 introduced this behavior.

So when you do Foo.my_assoc.my_scope:
When my_scope gets constructed it is within the scope of my_assoc, so it saves that scope's finder conditions internally. When you then evaluate the scope and the association to fetch records, my_assoc and my_scope both apply the association finder conditions separately so you end up with it twice in your query.

I'm guessing this is fixed in rails 3 by arel, but I have not checked.

So when you do Foo.my_assoc.my_scope: When my_scope gets constructed it is within the scope of my_assoc, so it saves that scope's finder conditions internally. When you then evaluate the scope and the association to fetch records, my_assoc and my_scope both apply the association finder conditions separately so you end up with it twice in your query.

version.body-html:
Probably not a bug, as it does not change the behavior. But I spent the afternoon tracking down why my association conditions were being applied twice in the query, so hopefully this ticket will prevent others from wasting an afternoon.

#1960 introduced this behavior.

So when you do Foo.my_assoc.my_scope:
When my_scope gets constructed it is within the scope of my_assoc, so it saves that scope's finder conditions internally. When you then evaluate the scope and the association to fetch records, my_assoc and my_scope both apply the association finder conditions separately so you end up with it twice in your query.

I'm guessing this is fixed in rails 3 by arel, but I have not checked.
version.title: Duplicate association conditions are generated when using a named_scope on an association

version.body: Thank you for noticing this issue. I'm seeing the exact same thing and its quite annoying. Any suggestions on how to fix this without having to include what's in the named scope within each instance?
version.body-html: Thank you for noticing this issue. I'm seeing the exact same thing and its quite annoying. Any suggestions on how to fix this without having to include what's in the named scope within each instance?
version.title: Duplicate association conditions are generated when using a named_scope on an association
Duplicate association conditions are generated when using a named_scope on an association

version.body:
Here I attach a fix for this duplication of conditions when applied to an AssociationCollection object.
This patch applies cleanly on 2-3-stable.
Please let me know any comment you may have.
version.body-html:
Here I attach a fix for this duplication of conditions when applied to an AssociationCollection object.

This patch applies cleanly on 2-3-stable.

Please let me know any comment you may have.

version.body: (from [9b78af95be01534b3f1a4187024d803313c0ee1f]) Remove duplication of conditions generated for associations when used in conjunction with named_scopes [#4634 state: resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/9b78af95be01534b3f1a4187024d803313c0ee1f
